intro: Solena angulata, commonly known as the angular solena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in late summer and early autumn. Solena angulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
